newsitem.title: USA: AT&T Universal Card president resigns.
newsitem.headline: AT&T Universal Card president resigns.

text.p: David Hunt, president of AT&T Universal Card Services, has resigned to pursue other business interests, AT&T said on Wednesday.
Hunt, 50, who joined AT&T in May 1993 will be replaced in the interim by Gerald Hines, who is chief operating officer of the Universal Card business.
"We have an external search already under way," said AT&T chief financial officer Richard Miller. "We appreciated David's contributions and wish him well," he said.
Hunt is evaluating several business opportunities, an AT&T spokeswoman said.

"In July AT&T and David discussed the direction of the business and David's career objectives, and it was at that time that a joint decision was made to make a change at the top," the spokeswoman told Reuters.

AT&T said it would continue to support the strategic direction of the unit, as a part of its communications services business. AT&T Universal Card is the second largest issuer of credit cards in the U.S. -- Nick Louth, New York Newsroom 212 859 1712
